text: Weiji attended the [National Diversity in STEM conference](https://s6.goeshow.com/sachn/ndsc/2024/), organized by [SACNAS](https://www.sacnas.org/), in Phoenix AZ, as a representative of the Neuroscience Graduate Program.
Ge (James) Jin, an undergraduate at Tandon School of Engineering, joined the lab. He will be working with Nastaran and Yiran on collaborative planning. Welcome James!
Peipei won the [2024 Best Dissertation Award](https://neuroeconomics.org/awards/) from Society for Neuroeconomics.

Weiji [was awarded](https://www.sfn.org/publications/latest-news/2024/09/16/society-for-neuroscience-2024-education-and-outreach-awards) an Award for Education in Neuroscience by the Society for Neuroscience.
[Yotam Sagiv](https://www.yotamsagiv.com/) joined the lab, fresh off getting his PhD with Nathaniel Daw and Ilana Witten. Welcome, Yotam!
Xiang successfully defended his PhD. Congratulations, Xiang!
We said goodbye to Peipei, who will stay at NYU but start as a postdoc in [Mark Ho's lab](https://codec-lab.github.io/).
Jennifer Yu, an undergraduate at Harvard, joined the lab. Jennifer will be working with Weiji on move times in chess. Welcome Jen!
Yiran Gong, an undergraduate at Barnard College, joined the lab. She will be working with Weiji and Nastaran on communication during collaboration. Welcome Yiran!

Peipei is a documentarymaker in her spare time. Her documentary [*The opposite of dying*](https://www.sheffdocfest.com/film/opposite-dying) was accepted to the prestigious Sheffield DocFest, to be held in June 2024.
We said goodbye to Shucheng Li, who will be returning to NYU Shanghai and continue to collaborate with us remotely.
Jordan and Weiji presented in the Center for Neural Science Lab Talks.

Weiji and Nastaran attended and presented at the [Cognitive Control of Action workshop](https://cocoa.psych.princeton.edu/) held at Princeton University. Nastaran presented new results from her work on collaborative planning.

Jordan and Jeroen attended and presented at Cosyne 2024 in Portugal. Jordan presented new results from our collaboration with [Daeyeol Lee's lab](https://sites.krieger.jhu.edu/daeyeol-lee-lab/) on the neural basis of planning.
Weiji presented remotely in the Neuroeconomics Seminar at the University of Zurich.
Weiji participated in a [CIMER](https://cimerproject.org/) workshop by Lindsay Frazier called "Optimizing Mentoring Relationships".
Weiji directed a Math and Coding Bootcamp for NYU undergraduates majoring or minoring in neuroscience or psychology. Jordan was one of the instructors.
We said goodbye to Hsin, who will be starting [a lab at The Ohio State University](https://www.hsinhungli.com/).
Peipei defended her PhD! Congratulations Peipei!
Ionatan defended his PhD! Congratulations Ionatan! He will be starting a postdoc position with Tom Griffiths at Princeton.

The lab was at the [Computational Cognitive Neuroscience conference](https://2023.ccneuro.org/) in Oxford. Ionatan, Jeroen, Jordan, Nastaran, and Peipei presented posters. Ili presented both a poster and [a talk](https://www.youtube.com/live/nxTSMQFx-HM?si=N1bLa8avz0L2ZTZ8&t=6647). Weiji and Ionatan moderated a group in the workshop [*How to be an Academic in a World on Fire*](https://2023.ccneuro.org/climate_crisis.php).

Hsin's Current Biology paper with Clay Curtis was featured in various news outlets. Read the press release [here](https://www.nyu.edu/about/news-publications/news/2023/august/more-than-meets-the-eye--new-research-shows-how-the-visual-syste.html).
Heiko [was profiled](https://zuckermaninstitute.columbia.edu/science-life-heiko-sch-tt) in *The Science Life* by Columbia's Zuckerman Institute.
Today was Sixuan's last day in the lab. Sixuan will be starting as a Ph.D. student in Cognitive Linguistic and Psychological Sciences at Brown University in Fall. Best of luck, Sixuan!
Hsin-Hung has accepted a faculty position in the Department of Psychology at Ohio State University. Congratulations, Hsin!
Weiji gave a Neuroscience Graduate Program Seminar, a Psychology Colloquium, and a Growing up in Science talk at UC San Diego.
Ili, Ionatan, Jeroen, Jordan, Nastaran, and Peipei all got their abstracts accepted to the [Cognitive Computational Neuroscience conference](https://2023.ccneuro.org/) in Oxford in August.
Weiji gave a Perception and Cognition Seminar at the University of Uppsala.
Nastaran gave her fourth-year talk about collaborative planning.
Weiji gave a Foundations of Data Science Seminar at Yale University.
Weiji gave a talk at the annual retreat of NYU's Neuroscience Institute.
Sixuan gave her [Computational Cognitive Science Community Forum](http://gureckislab.org/concats/communityforum.html) research presentation about path length estimation.
Peipei gave her [Concats](http://gureckislab.org/concats/) talk about the dynamic nature of procrastination.
Today was Heiko's last day. He will be starting his own lab at the University of Luxembourg. Best of luck, Heiko!
Weiji received the [Impact Goals Award](https://researchinsociety.org/award/wei-ji-ma/) from the Center for Advancing Research Impact in Society (ARIS).
Xiang and Weiji each presented a poster at [Cosyne](https://www.cosyne.org) 2023 in Montreal.
Peipei presented in the annual meeting of the [Society for Personality and Social Psychology](https://spsp.org).
Jeroen gave his CNS first-year talk on complex problem solving with Rush Hour. Jordan gave his CNS first-year talk on the effect of environmental stochasticity on depth of planning.

Ionatan discussed ["How Subversion Saved Anime"](http://animenyc.com/programming/#/event/how-subversion-saved-anime) in a panel at Anime NYC. He leads a parallel life as a podcaster about anime. You can listen to his podcast bakabanter [here](https://linktr.ee/bakabanter).
Wei Ji spoke in the Current Works in Cognitive Science series at Yale University.

Jordan co-directed a short film "Access Denied" with Asia Khmelova that premiered at the [@imaginescience](https://twitter.com/imaginescience) Film Festival. The Symbiosis Competition pairs scientists and filmmakers to make a short film in one week. Watch it [here](https://player.vimeo.com/video/762955684?h=c5b6166d3d).
Peipei and Xiang presented in the Center for Neural Science Lab Talks.
Elsa Mauguin, a Masters student in computational neuroscience at EPFL (Lausanne), started her three-month research placement in the lab. Welcome!
Neuroscience PhD students Jordan Lei and Jeroen Olieslagers joined the lab, as well as Research Assistant/Lab manager Sixuan Chen. Welcome!

Wei Ji participated (mostly through a pre-recorded video) in the opening workshop of the Generative Adversarial Collaboration titled ["To what extent does the brain simulate the external world?"](https://gac.ccneuro.org/gacs-by-year/2022-gacs/2022-2), part of the Cognitive Computational Neuroscience conference.
Today was Dongjae's last day in the lab. Dongjae was in the lab for just over a year, and he is now starting a faculty job at Dankook University. All the best, Dongjae!

Today was Luisa's last day in the lab. Luisa started out as an undergraduate Honors student, then continued as a research assistant/lab manager for the past half year. She is now going to prepare for the MCATs. All the best, Luisa!
Neuroscience PhD student Jordan Lei started a rotation in the lab. Welcome, Jordan!
Neuroscience PhD student Jeroen Olieslagers started a rotation in the lab. Welcome, Jeroen!
Dongjae received and accepted a faculty job offer at Dankook University. Congratulations, Dongjae!!
Cognition and Perception PhD student Nastaran Arfaei joined the lab. Welcome, Nastaran!
Luisa presented in the CNS Undergraduate Research Festival. The title of her talk was "Procrastination and its Subtypes."

[Anatola Araba](http://www.anatolaaraba.com/)’s short film “Afro Algorithms”, in which Weiji was a scientific consultant, [premiered at Mozfest](https://www.awn.com/news/mozfest-premieres-alfro-algorithms-animated-short). Read an interview with Anatola [here](https://techvangart.com/2020/09/21/ai-beyond-programming-afro-algorithms/).
Dongjae Kim and Daisy Lin presented in the CNS lab talks.
Jenn successfully defended her thesis "Representations of uncertainty in perceptual decision-making". Congratulations!

[Quanta Magazine](https://www.quantamagazine.org/neural-noise-shows-the-uncertainty-of-our-memories-20220118/) wrote about Hsin's [recent paper](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neuron.2021.08.022) on the neural representation of working memory uncertainty.
Sam gave his CNS first-year talk on the project he has been doing with the lab.
Weiji gave a talk and a [Growing up in Science](http://www.growingupinscience.org) session at the Cognitive Science program at Indiana University, Bloomington.
Weiji discussed gradeless teaching during NYU's [TeachTalks](https://teachingsupport.hosting.nyu.edu/teachtalks/). The session is called *To B or not to B: Low-Stakes Assessment and “Ungrading”*.
Ionatan gave his CNS third-year talk, on a statistical model for planning.
Weiji held a remote [Growing up in Science](http://www.growingupinscience.org) session for the [Chinese Open Science Network](https://open-sci.cn).

Jenn published [a review](https://magazine.scienceforthepeople.org/vol24-2-dont-be-evil/from-scientists-to-salesmen/) in *[Science for the people](https://magazine.scienceforthepeople.org/)* about the documentary *[In Silico](https://insilicofilm.com/)* about the monstrous, failed Human Brain Project.
Xiang presented at the Concepts and Categories seminar.
Weiji presented at the CRCNS PI Meeting on his joint work with the lab of Daeyeol Lee at Johns Hopkins.
Weiji held a remote [Growing up in Science](http://www.growingupinscience.org) session at the Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences.
Weiji held a remote [Growing up in Science](http://www.growingupinscience.org) session at the [Vienna Doctoral School in Cognition, Behavior and Neuroscience](https://vds-cobene.univie.ac.at/).

The video of Weiji's acceptance speech of the [Jeffrey Elman prize for scientific achievement and community building](https://cognitivesciencesociety.org/elman-prize/) of the Cognitive Science Society is [now available](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kj0byhMbR2o).
Weiji was a panelist in the professional development sessions "Mentor-mentee communication" in [Neuromatch Academy 2021](https://academy.neuromatch.io/).
Also at [CogSci 2021](https://cognitivesciencesociety.org/cogsci-2021/), Ionatan had a talk and Peipei a poster.

Weiji spoke in the workshop *[Using games to understand intelligence](https://cognitivesciencesociety.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/WS2.pdf)* at [CogSci 2021](https://cognitivesciencesociety.org/cogsci-2021/). In the same workshop, Jiawen Huang (Columbia) presented collaborative work between Chris Baldassano's lab and our lab.
Weiji received the [Jeffrey L. Elman Prize for Scientific Achievement and Community Building](https://cognitivesciencesociety.org/elman-prize/) during a special symposium.
Peipei spoke in the [Life Improvement Science inaugural conference](https://www.life-improvement.science/conference-schedule).

The Computational Cognitive Science laboratories in the Department of Psychology (Gureckis, Hartley, Lake, Ma, and Rehder) held a joint lab meeting with cross-presentations (which means that everyone presents someone else's slides). Peipei and Xiang presented.
Weiji co-organized the Computational Neuroscience Symposium of the joint Training Programs in Computational Neuroscience.
Weiji participated in a faculty mentorship course organized by Yael Niv and Laura Murray.
Heiko Schütt and Hsin-Hung Li presented in the Center for Neural Science Lab Talks.

Weiji organized and spoke in the 2021 Teaching Symposium for the Department of Psychology. [Recording (NYU login required)](https://stream.nyu.edu/media/NYU+Psychology+Teaching+Symposium+2021/1_zd9b1s9n)
Weiji participated in "Meet the professors" at the virtual meeting of the Vision Sciences Society.

Ionatan and Weiji presented about the Scientist Action and Advocacy Network for the [Science and Education Policy Association](https://sepanyc.org/), a joint group between Weill Cornell Medical School, Rockefeller University and Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center.
Weiji gave a talk and a [Growing up in Science](http://www.growingupinscience.org) session at the Max Planck Institute Tuebingen.

Weiji was the co-organizer and moderator of the [Workshop on Race and Racism in Science](https://as.nyu.edu/content/nyu-as/as/departments/cns/events/EventDescriptions/WorkshopRace.html), held by the Department of Psychology, the Center for Neural Science, and the Department of Biology.
Luisa presented in the CNS Undergraduate Research Festival. The title of her talk was "An empirical measure of procrastination and the intention-behavior gap".
The lab had one CogSci abstract accepted as a poster and two as talks. Congrats all!
Qixiu Fu (recent lab alumna) accepted an offer to join the Neuroscience Ph.D. Program at Mount Sinai Icahn School of Medicine. Congratulations, Qixiu!

Weiji gave a [Growing up in Science](http://www.growingupinscience.org) talk at Maastricht University, organized by the [Maastricht Young Academy](https://www.maastrichtuniversity.nl/research/maastricht-young-academy).
A [goat](https://twitter.com/weijima01/status/1367191340262563840?s=20) visited our lab meeting. [Invite one too](https://www.cronkshawfoldfarm.co.uk/goatsonzoom).
Weiji was a panelist in the Science Communication and Activism Career Panel organized by Biomedical Graduate Studies and the Immunology Graduate Student Association at the University of Pennsylvania.

Weiji was the organizer and moderator of a mini-symposium at the [Cosyne 2021](https://static1.squarespace.com/static/6102ca347474c263c40150cd/t/610870a432c9d257a80cace4/1627943077187/Cosyne2021_program_book.pdf) conference on the role of race and racism in science. [Video here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q8bUXAjUJyY).
Weiji gave a scientific talk and a [Growing up in Science](http://www.growingupinscience.org) talk in the Department of Cognitive Science at Central European University.
Xiang gave his fourth-year talk in the Cognition and Perception miniconvention.

It was announced that Weiji was awarded the [Jeffrey L. Elman Prize 2021](https://cognitivesciencesociety.org/elman-prize/#2021elman) for scientific achievement and community building by the Cognitive Science Society.
Weiji was the inaugural guest in the [Psych Mic podcast](https://www.psychmic.com/podcast/episode/4b8ce165/pivoting-mentors-and-keeping-science-human-or-dr-weiji-ma) by Maya Metser.
Weiji spoke at UCLA's Cognitive Psychology Forum.
Weiji spoke at Stanford's Center for Mind, Brain, Computation, and Technology Seminar.

Weiji co-organized and co-hosted (with Yael Niv and Celia Ford) the second [*Growing up in Science* Online Open Forum](http://www.growingupinscience.com), with the theme "feeling apathetic about research." [Video of the meeting](https://nyu.zoom.us/rec/share/6PV_frHTyWxOX7fsz1PNYK0PD7TvT6a823Qa-vcEzBr5BxoW92lB-pWUSW0RylG5)

Hsin and Weiji hosted a virtual journal club on [Li and Ma (2020)](./static/files/publications/2020%20Li%20Ma.pdf). [Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VH1qQ4gfvqw&list=PLmX7T5IuDU4e47pXAbeFwLUOGt7Y3vMio&index=2) | [Slides](./static/files/onlinetalks/20200504%20Hsin-Hung%20Li.pdf)
Weiji co-organized and co-hosted (with Yael Niv) the first [*Growing up in Science* Online Open Forum](http://www.growingupinscience.com).
Weiji spoke in the [NYU Psychology Masters Program Research Conference](https://sites.google.com/nyu.edu/ma-conference/home).

Weiji spoke in a virtual symposium [*Problems in neural and cognitive computation*](https://www.gc.cuny.edu/Page-Elements/Academics-Research-Centers-Initiatives/Masters-Programs/Liberal-Studies/Program-Events/Detail?id=54155), organized by the Initiative for the Theoretical Sciences at the CUNY Graduate Center.
Weiji won one of the [Golden Dozen Teaching Awards](https://cas.nyu.edu/content/nyu-as/cas/teaching-awards.html) from NYU's College of Arts and Sciences.

Weiji (with Daryl Fougnie) hosted a virtual journal club on [Honig, Ma, Fougnie (2020)](./static/files/publications/2020%20Honig%20Ma%20Fougnie.pdf). About 130 people attended! [Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vwdY0Y-3thk&list=PLmX7T5IuDU4e47pXAbeFwLUOGt7Y3vMio&index=3)
Ionatan [won](https://www.research.gov/grfp/AwardeeList.do?method=loadAwardeeList) a Graduate Research Fellowship from the National Science Foundation. Congratulations!

Weiji gave an invited lecture and a [*Growing up in Science*](http://www.growingupinscience.com) seminar at the [Computational and Systems Neuroscience conference](http://www.cosyne.org/c/index.php?title=Cosyne_20) in Denver, CO.
Weiji gave [an invited lecture](https://psych.princeton.edu/event/wei-ji-ma-new-york-university) in the Department of Psychology at Princeton University.
Weiji gave [an invited lecture](https://psychology.columbia.edu/events/monday-seminar-wei-ji-ma) in the Department of Psychology at Columbia University.
Aspen and Ionatan presented in the Center for Neural Science Lab Talks seminar series.
Weiji teamed up with [Aaron Duffy](http://www.aaronduffy.com) to teach a guest lecture about illusions, inference, and a better society in Yael Niv's freshman seminar at Princeton University.
Weiji gave a [*Growing up in Science*](http://www.growingupinscience.com) seminar at Weill Cornell Medicine.

Weiji, Bas, and Ionatan visited Oxford University, where Weiji spoke about human planning in large state spaces and gave a [*Growing up in Science*](http://www.growingupinscience.com) seminar the next day.

Weiji, Bas, and Ionatan visited the Gatsby Computational Neuroscience Unit at University College London, where Weiji spoke about human planning in large state spaces and gave a [*Growing up in Science*](http://www.growingupinscience.com) seminar.
Weiji, Bas, Ionatan, and Jake visited Google DeepMind, where Weiji spoke about human planning in large state spaces.
Weiji, Bas, and Ionatan visited [Peak Brain Training](https://www.peak.net) in London, a company with whom we are collaborating to collect mobile game data.
Weiji spoke in the [Minds and machines](http://as.nyu.edu/content/nyu-as/as/mindsandmachines.html) event at NYU.
Ionatan gave his CNS first-year talk, on human planning in four-in-a-row.

Weiji spoke in the [Scholars Lecture Series](http://cas.nyu.edu/content/nyu-as/cas/scholarslectures.html) at NYU, a lecture series primarily for undergraduates in the [Presidential Honors Scholars Program](http://cas.nyu.edu/content/nyu-as/cas/academic-programs/honors-programs.html).
Weiji spoke in [*Behind the CV: Stories from Faculty (a 'Growing Up in Science' event)*](https://mindcore.sas.upenn.edu/behind-the-cv/) at the University of Pennsylvania.
We said goodbye to Jenn Lee, who will start a job at the data science branch of Employment and Social Development Canada, while continuing her PhD.
The lab participated in the Center for Neural Science retreat.
Jenn gave her CNS third-year talk, on representational constraints on Bayesian perceptual reasoning.
Weiji gave the Cognition and Perception Seminar.
Weiji gave the Millward Colloquium at Brown University, and led a *Growing up in Science* session.
We went on lab retreat in Shelter Island, NY. This was the fourth lab retreat.
Xiang presented at Cognition & Perception Program's 40th Annual Miniconvention.
Weiji gave the Social Psychology Brown Bag seminar.
The lab participated in the [global climate strike](https://www.brightest.io/cause/fridays-for-future/activity/new-york-city-climate-strike-with-greta-thunberg/).
Marie Chancel, a postdoc working on body ownership with Henrik Ehrsson at the Karolinska Institute in Stockholm, visited the lab.

Heiko, Ionatan, Jenn, Peipei, Xiang, Yichen, and Weiji attended the [Cognitive Computational Neuroscience](https://ccneuro.org/2019/schedule.asp) meeting in Berlin, and each presented a poster. Weiji moderated a breakout session on tasks to compare human and artificial intelligence.
Former postdoc Luigi Acerbi visited and gave a workshop on model fitting, in particular the [BADS algorithm](https://github.com/lacerbi/bads).
Aspen successfully defended her dissertation! Congratulations!
Weiji started as Director of Undergraduate Studies for the Department of Psychology. He will fill this role for one year.
Yichen was admitted as an undergraduate trainee to NYU's Training Program in Computational Neuroscience. Congratulations!
Dongqi (Sherry) Bao joined the lab. She will be a research assistant and lab manager. She got her Masters from ETH Zurich in Computational Biology and Bioinformatics. Welcome!
We said goodbye to Anne-Lene Sax, who was a visiting PhD student this summer and will continue as a collaborator.
